start_faery_cutscene: ^Is that Melody? Yes. At least I've come to the right place.
^Everyone's forgotten all about music! And they don't even know they forgot!
fairy_earworm_scene: ^Oh dear! Oh no! I can't believe this is happening...
^The Evil EarWorm has stolen their music memories right out of their heads!
^Only Melody can help the village remember! Help us, Melody. You're our only hope...
end_fairy_cutscene: ^Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear… Ah, here she is.
^I’m sorry to wake you, but I need your help!
^What’s wrong? I’ll help if I can!
^Everyone has lost their memory of music.
^Oh no! The ear worm has stolen your memory too? But you were the best musician of all…
^You sure were! So can you help me restore the townspeople’s memory of music?
^I’ll try my best! How should I start?
^First of all, let’s explore your controls. Tap the screen or click your mouse to move.
tutorial_bedroom_movement: ^Great work! Now try opening those curtains! Just tap them or click on them.
tutorial_bedroom_curtains: ^Some important objects will stand out. Try turning on the blue lamp.
tutorial_bedroom_lamp: ^Finally, you’ll want to get dressed before heading downstairs.
tutorial_bedroom_wardrobe: ^Nice outfit! Now you’re ready. Let’s go!

b: ^I feel kind of strange today, can't quite put my finger on it.
^Good, you found the scythe! Give this big lumber pile a whack.
^Uncle is still trying to fix his carriage. I'm sure he would appreciate some help...
^Just walk south down the path, you'll see him.
^Looks like it'll be a sunny one today.
^Please do something about this unsightly lump of lumber!
^Oh, as ready as I'll ever be! What's first?
^We found this big pile of firewood in the living room.
^But it's all stuck together. Can you chop it into smaller pieces?
^Thanks, Melody! You can just use the scythe, out in front of the house.
^Firewood!? Your parents forgot all about music, too!
^Melody, would you mind checking on the cows?
^This looks pretty weird for a "pile of lumber." And why does it have a keyhole?
^Whatever you do, don't hurt that piano!
^That's no kindling. It's a piano! A piano is a musical instrument.
^Don't cry. I won't hurt this... "piano" if it means that much to you.
^Great! Hooray! The lid of the piano is closed and locked right now.
^I was going to open it up, but I dropped the key in your wheat field.
^You did it! You got the key! I knew you could do it!
^Let me just try this key in the lock... Done!
^Play "Ode to Joy!" You'll see the notes on the screen. That's your dad's favorite tune!
^What is this big wooden thing in my house?

pianoquest_scythe: ^I finally get to use the scythe! Father never let me because it's sharp.
^I had better see if I can use it on that pile of kindling in the house.
pianoquest_scarecrow_inanimate: ^The scarecrow stares blankly into the distance.
pianoquest_scarecrow: ^If you want it back, you'll have to answer my questions! Are you ready?

c-1: ^ I need more time to study.

pianoquest_trivia_success: ^Good work! You passed. Here you go.
^I should go back to the house and try this on that "piano" thing.

c-1: ^ I need more time to study.

pianoquest_played_song: ^I... I remember that sound! That was Ode to Joy! by my favorite composer, Beethoven!
^Yes! And this is a piano, not firewood.
^I can't believe I forgot! I must have been out of my mind. Hooray!
^We sure did. Nice work, Melody. But there's still a lot of work left to do!
^Will you find the rest of the musical instruments and save them?

b: ^Are you looking for more instruments to save?
^I bet there are more in town! Hop in, I'll give you a ride!
^I can't believe the Ear Worm tried to steal our memories of music!
^If you want to fight him, you'll need more musical power!
^I think there's one more instrument on this farm...
^Are you here to try my trivia again?
^This dang carriage wheel! Why won't this spoke fit?
^Of course I can. Say, could you do me a favor?
^What do you need me to do?
^Can you help your Uncle remember his favorite song? ...
^I remember that! It's... Hot Cross Buns, of course!
^Yep! Uncle used to play it on his trombone all the time.
^Now he seems to think his trombone is a wheel spoke. Silly human...
^I can try to help. What should I do?
^Maybe if you play the melody for him, he'll remember! Try it!

trombonequest_played_song: ^And this this... it's not a wheel spoke. It's my trombone!
^It sure is. By the way, can I please borrow it? I have to go collect all the rest of the instruments of the orchestra!
^Of course. But first, you should learn some basic facts about the trombone.
trombonequest_trivia_fail: ^Whoops! Would you like to try again?

c-1: ^ I need more time to study.

b: ^Aww, Father let you use the scythe?
^Could you catch a trumpetfish from the pond? Let's have fish for dinner tonight!
^I'm so hungry! Did you bring a trumpetfish? It's my favorite!
^No fish – but I did bring your trumpet back! It's a musical instrument!
^Maybe if you play something, he'll remember!
^Hey Sis... I feel like there's something important that I'm forgetting to do...

trumpetquest_pole: ^My fishing pole! Maybe I can use it on that sparkly spot over there...
trumpetquest_fished: ^That's your brother's trumpet! He's quite a talented player!
^Really? I had better take it back to him!
trumpetquest_played_song: ^Wait, song?! Did I forget about music?
^Will you help me fix things? I need to borrow your trumpet to beat a monster.
^Yes! Stealing music is bad - teach that monster a lesson!

b: ^It's a cool new baton I found. It's for pointing at chalkboards.
^That's not for pointing at chalkboards! That's a flute!
^Are you here to try my trivia again?

flutequest_trivia_success: ^Fascinating! I still don't entirely understand, but thank you for teaching me!
^Now that you know it's a flute, can I borrow it?
flutequest_trivia_fail: ^Hmm, I'm still not convinced, Melody! Try again?

c-1: ^ I need more time to study.

b: ^Yep! It's me, Joan the Village Goof!
^Why are you up in that tree?
^I'm comforting the apples. They're afraid to fall down.
^That's sweet of you. What's that you're holding?
^This? Why, it's just my friend Chucky. He's helping me.
^Chucky? It looks like a violin to me!
^A violin is a musical instrument. It makes pretty sounds.
^Hmm, interesting. I didn't know Chucky could make pretty sounds.
^If you think Chucky is a "muzribble instrabob," prove it!

violinquest_trivia_success: ^Oops! I hope that didn't hurt, Chucky!
^You bet! Have a nice day. I'll be here comforting the remaining apples.
violinquest_trivia_fail: ^But that was a fun game! Want to play again?

c-1: ^ I need more time to study.

b: ^Tired! What can I help you with?
^That? It's a new table someone was nice enough to leave me.
^A table? It looks like a bass drum.
^What's a bass drum? Let's see what you know.

drumquest_trivia_success: ^Well, I'll be! It really is a musical instrument! Thank you!
^You're welcome! Now, may I please borrow the bass drum for a bit?
drumquest_trivia_fail: ^It's okay to make mistakes, as long as you learn from them! Try again?

c-1: ^ I need more time to study.

scythe_destroy_prompt: ^You can break these boxes with your scythe. Try clicking on them!
scythe_pickup_prompt: ^Look! Isn't that the scythe? You should pick it up!
scythe_wheat_prompt: ^I know I dropped the key in here somewhere... will you use your scythe to find it?
book_strings: ^I found another one of those books!
book_percussion: ^Another book! I wonder what it's about?
book_piano: ^This book is missing some pages. Maybe I can find them nearby.
hornquest_fished: ^Is that something sparkling in the river?
^Better hang on to it until you find out who it belongs to...

b: ^Say now, what's that shiny squiggle you've got there?
^French bread? That's no French bread I ever saw!
^You know the drill – play a song he'll like!

hornquest_played_song: ^Why, my old mum used to play me that song, on that very horn!
^I knew it was his! He's a great horn player!
^Ezekiel, can I borrow your horn? I need to share music with everyone!
tubaquest_fished: ^I think I see something in the fountain...
^It's a tuba! Doesn't its sad sound make you think of someone?
^Maybe that cranky coach driver Philip knows something about it...

b: ^You don't have any money to rent a carriage, go away!
^Put that big metal thing away, you'll scare the horses!
^Philip, don't you remember this? It's a tuba!
^A tube of what? Get out of here!
^I just know this tuba belongs to him! Can you convince him with music?

tubaquest_played_song: ^That sad song! It makes me so happy!
^Philip, you're so strange! But you've been such a big help.
^May I borrow your tuba? I need to make sure nobody else forgets!
^I'm in such a good mood, I'll let you hang on to it!

b: ^Mr. Philip isn't usually this grumpy, but today he woke up on the wrong side of the bed. Can you help?
^Mr. Philip is in such a good mood! What did you do?!
^You've done a great service for my lady! Thank you!
^My lady won't stop crying. Look at how sad she is!
^I just look at this magic wand, and it makes me so upset!
^That's not a magic wand! It's an oboe, a musical instrument!
^I wish I knew what any of that meant!
^See what I mean? Can you help my lady sing with me again?

oboequest_played_song: ^I felt like something was missing, but you gave it back to me!
^Why don't you keep that... oboe, was it? I only need my voice to sing with Gucci!
^Lady Alley and Gucci look so happy now!

b: ^Tempo Town – what a great name I came up with!
^Melody, it's you! Maybe you can help me with something.
^I'm embarrassed to say that I've forgotten the name of our town!
^I just remember that it had something to do with this noisy object here...
^That "object" is a snare drum! It's used to keep the time of a song.

snarequest_right: ^And this is a snare drum - we use that to keep a tempo!
^Melody, I want you to have my snare drum! I think you helped me get my memory back.
^I promise to make sure everyone remembers the name of our town!
^You're one step closer to defeating the Ear Worm!

b: ^Melody! Come look! Check out this huge dustpan I found!
^Innkeeper Theophilus, doesn't that seem pretty heavy for a dustpan?
^It's a musical instrument – it makes a beautiful sound!
^Now you're talking nonsense! I have to get back to my cleaning.
^Melody! Can I get you some apple cider?

bassquest_played_song: ^You're right, that is a beautiful sound!
^It's music! An evil worm stole it from us, and I intend to get it back!
^Could I borrow your bass? I promise I'll return it!
^A "bass," you say? Well, sure – take it!

b: ^I feel like a piece of me has been ripped away!
^I saw the Earm Worm steal his beloved lute last night...
^Maybe that viola on the shelf would make him feel better!
^Why don't you play a song with that viola over there?
^I shall put on a musical concert, oui oui!

violaquest_played_song: ^Yes! This... "song" – it lifts my very soul!
^I remember now - the evil Ear Worm took my joy from me.
^We're going to defeat him – and we need that viola to do it!
^Take it, and use it to teach that foul worm a lesson!

b: ^Why, hello to you, my dear Melody!
^Healer Leonora, do you play the clarinet?
^Play? I don't play, dear, I have too much work to do mixing healing potions!
^At least this new stirring-stick I found helps me mix faster!
^That's no stirring-stick – that's a musical instrument!
^May I show you how it works?
^Well, I suppose. But don't take too long with your game, I'm very busy!
^Can I interest you in a tincture of some sort?

clarinetquest_played_song: ^That was music! Everyone forgot about it, but I'm going to fix that.
^I couldn't possibly use such a fine thing to stir potions.
^You're getting so good at this, Melody!

b: ^Healer Leonora has been acting so strangely lately...
^Healer Leonora is back to normal! Thank you!
^Melody! Good to see you. I wish we could catch up, but...
^If she won't take a nap, I can't hang laundry on my shiny new rack!
^He seriously thinks that harp is a laundry rack? Now I've heard it all!
^Baby Wendy is finally asleep. Thank you!
^But now where will we dry our laundry?

harpquest_played_song: ^That peaceful sound... Wendy is falling asleep!
^May I borrow your harp to bring music to the town?
^Well, alright. I was going to dry laundry on it but...
^...but of course, we're in your debt! Take it!

b: ^I feel strange, truth be told. Like something's missing...
^Psst! Look behind him - that's a marimba!
^Why do you have all those fruits piled on that marimba?
^Marimba? Ah, that must be a fancy name for my new produce table!
^That's no table – that's a musical instrument!
^A good song is like a juicy fresh fruit, don't you think?

marimbaquest_played_song: ^What is this feeling? How'd you do that?
^That feeling is joy - that's the magic of music!
^I don't need this for fruits! Here, you take it.
fortune_teller: ^You look lost, would you like the crystal ball to tell your future?

b: ^A baby cries out beneath a tree...
^A great man stands among marble columns...
^The object you seek lies below the pineapple...
^Look for the flames of the forge...
^The sounds of a fountain beckon you...
^I see strings, nestled among the apples...
^A shiny bearded head appears to me from the orb...
^A wise woman to the north has the object you seek.
^A loaf of bread floats down a rushing river...
^A small bird gazes at his beloved...
^The portal beckons you. Go to it.

fortune_weird: ^Usually the crystal ball has more to say.
^This is giving me the creeps! Let's get out of here!
portal_enter: ^Done... what? What is this awful thing?
^You saved all the musical instruments, and their magic opened a portal!
^Quickly now, let's go banish the Earworm back to his own planet!
^Let's go teach that Ear Worm a lesson!
finalexam_earworm: ^Ah, Spirit of Music! I should have known you’d meddle with my plans.
^And you. Pesky kid! You’re the most tone-deaf of them all.
finalexam_fairy: ^This is it, Melody - time to put your knowledge to the test!
^See those glowing spots? Walk up to each one to place an instrument.
finalexam_worm_state_1: ^You should keep going! Keep placing those instruments!
finalexam_worm_state_3: ^No! You rotten kid! Now I'm really mad!
finalexam_worm_state_4: ^Now you've done it, you rotten kid!
^You… you win! I give up! Music is too strong for me.
^Tell me, Ear Worm. Why do you hate music so much?
^Where I’m from, we don’t have any music at all.
^Then why don’t you take some music home with you?
^Sometimes the hard things are the most fun of all!
^You did it, Melody! I knew you could! Let's go home.
finalexam_piano: ^You think you know everything about this piano, do you?
^What is the name of the part of the piano where your feet are placed?
finalexam_harp: ^The harp and the piano are both members of what two instrument families?
finalexam_marimba: ^I bet you don't know what that thing is!
finalexam_marimba_right: ^I was just going easy on you!
finalexam_bass_drum: ^What could a twerp like you know about a bass drum?
^To which family does the bass drum belong?
finalexam_snare_drum: ^Ever seen a snare drum, smarty pants?
^Well then, what part of it are you supposed to hit?
finalexam_snare_drum_right: ^Hmmph. I guess you do know a little bit. But it won't save your precious music!
^That's enough out of you, Ear Worm!
finalexam_french_horn: ^Don't try to act so smart! Do you even know what instrument family the French horn is in?
finalexam_french_horn_wrong: ^I knew it! No kid could know so much about instruments.
finalexam_french_horn_right: ^I did my homework, Ear Worm, just like you should have!
finalexam_trumpet: ^I bet you don't know anything about this trumpet, little kid!
^Then what is the word for the big, wide end piece of a trumpet, where the sound comes out?
finalexam_trumpet_right: ^How could you know that? You must have cheated!
finalexam_trombone: ^I've had enough of you acting like you know about musical instruments!
^You probably don't even know what part of this trombone you move to make sound!
finalexam_trombone_right: ^I guess I'll keep being lucky, then!
finalexam_tuba: ^This instrument is bigger than you are! Aren't you scared, little kid?
^Well then, what is it called? I bet you don't know!
finalexam_tuba_right: ^You got that right? How did you know?
finalexam_bass: ^Think you're smart, eh? Well, what's this instrument, then?
finalexam_bass_wrong: ^And here I thought you knew so much!
finalexam_bass_right: ^I love these instruments, Ear Worm! You shouldn't have stolen them!
finalexam_viola: ^Tell me this, smarty: What do you call the stick you use to play this viola?
finalexam_viola_right: ^You knew? But you're just a kid!
^Even kids can learn about music, Ear Worm!
finalexam_violin: ^You'll never be able to answer my super-tough violin question!
^To what instrument family does the violin belong, hmm?
finalexam_violin_right: ^No! You can't know all of this!
finalexam_oboe: ^Smart one, eh? Well then, to what instrument family does this oboe belong?
finalexam_oboe_wrong: ^Silly kid! I guess you don't know as much as you claim!
finalexam_flute: ^You probably don't even know what this instrument is, kid!
finalexam_flute_wrong: ^Ha, ha - that was the wrong answer!
finalexam_flute_right: ^You just can't admit that Melody knows all about these instruments!
finalexam_clarinet: ^If you know so much, tell me this...
^The "buttons" you use to change the sound of this clarinet are called what?
finalexam_clarinet_right: ^You.. you... you punk! How could you know that?

b: ^Well, Melody, are you ready to wrap it up?
^It's our hero! Say goodbye to your friends here and when you're done, come talk to me!

celebration_mayor_not_yet: ^Say your goodbyes, and let me know when you're ready to go.
celebration_mayor_thanks: ^Thanks for everything you did today, Melody. We'll never forget music again!
^You did it, Melody! Let's go home.
